author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Big waves inundate Capitola village with seawater
text:
Summary by Ground News Multiple inches of seawater covers roadways and sidewalks in Capitola village. Residents worry the high surf will cause more damage to beachfront properties and businesses. City workers removed garbage cans and closed roads in anticipation of the big waves. Crews are on schedule to complete the restoration project by this summer as long as it doesn't get torn apart. author: Andrea Torres
title: Organized fraud case: 2 steal from their Medley employer; 2 buy-sell stolen goods, police say
text:
MEDLEY, Fla. – Detectives reported a man referred to an organized fraud case out of Miami-Dade County’s town of Medley as an “under the table” deal.
The Medley Police Department announced the case on Thursday involved the arrests of Guillermo Gonzalez, Rolando Bazail, Reynel Castillo, and Roylis Rodriguez.
Recommended Videos
“These arrests mark a significant breakthrough in our ongoing efforts to combat organized crime,” Officer Deglys Chavarria, a spokesman for the department, wrote in a statement.
The group defrauded Countywide of Miami, a Medley-based fleet management company, of nearly $78,000 from August 2023 to Wednesday.
Detectives identified Gonzalez, 45, and Bazail, 46, as Countywide of Miami employees, at 8501 NW 80 St. Surveillance videos show they arrived 45 minutes early to move plywood stacks to a loading dock.
The duo would then sell the plywood they had stolen to awaiting buyers. Detectives identified Castillo and Rodriguez as the two buyers present when Gonzalez and Diaz were arrested.
Reynel Castillo, left, and Roylis Rodriguez, were arrested over an organized scheme to defraud in Miami-Dade County. (MDPD) Rodriguez, 44, a certified tradesman for residential repairs, had used Zelle to pay Gonzalez about $15,000 for the stolen plywood.
The four men faced charges of organized fraud of $50,000 or more. They remained at the Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center on Thursday afternoon.
Castillo and Rodriguez faced an additional charge of dealing in stolen property.
Detectives asked anyone with information about this or other cases to call Miami-Dade County Crime Stoppers at 305-471-8477.
Copyright 2024 by WPLG Local10.com - All rights reserved.

author: Delia Reynolds
title: Indeed Survey: AI, Diversity, and Inclusion to Take Centre Stage in 2024
text:
AI, Diversity, Inclusion Will Take Centre Stage in 2024: Indeed Survey
AI, Diversity, Inclusion Will Take Centre Stage in 2024: Indeed Survey
In light of the recent news by a recent Indeed survey, the workplace is gearing up to adopt artificial intelligence, with a strong focus on diversity and inclusion. The survey revealed that employees are confident in their ability to adapt to AI tools, and employers are planning to implement policies to embrace diversity and inclusion.
Adoption of AI and Meeting Gen Z Expectations
The survey highlighted that both employees and employers are looking towards the adoption of AI tools and meeting the expectations of Gen Z employees. Employees are confident in their ability to adapt to AI, while employers are focused on building workplace strategies tailored to Gen Z.
Focus on Diversity and Inclusion
Employers are showcasing strong intentions to embrace diversity and inclusion policies, with a forthcoming surge in policy adoption. The top three strategies that employers plan to implement include open communication channels, diverse leadership representation, and anti-discrimination reporting.

author: Matthew Seeman
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Fantastic weather is in the forecast on Martin Luther King Jr Day with temperatures climbing throughout the week... We will wrap up the weekend with a storm moving in on Sunday...{/p}{p}TODAY: If you're heading downtown to the MLK Day Parade, temperatures will be around 50 degrees at 10 am. Expect partly cloudy skies on Monday with high temperatures reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas. Winds will stay light out of the north up to 10 mph throughout the day.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' for most valley neighborhoods with levels 'unhealthy for sensitive groups' in the east valley. Pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold valley low temperatures dropping to around 39 degrees.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Temperatures will keep climbing throughout the work week with highs in the low to mid 60s as high pressure builds. A storm will move into the West Coast on Wednesday, bringing rain and snow showers to Northern Nevada. Temperatures will max out around 65 degrees on Saturday in Las Vegas, followed by a stronger storm moving into Southern Nevada on Sunday. A slight chance of rain showers will be possible in the valley on Sunday (about 20% chance) with light rain amounts anticipated. Forecast totals will be anything from a trace up to .10\". Mountain snow will be more likely on Sunday but the heaviest snow is forecast for the Sierra Mountains to our west. In between the two storms this week some parts of the Sierra will get up to 30\" of snow from now into the start of NEXT week.{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day forecast, rain shower chances will linger in Las Vegas Sunday through Monday with highs in the 50s. Conditions appear to clear up by NEXT Tuesday and Wednesday with valley highs rebounding back to the mid 60s under mostly sunny to partly cloudy skies.{/p}{p}Check back for more updates & have a great day!{/p}{p}- Chloe Koast{ }{/p}{p}{br}{/p}{p}The first Red Flag exercise of the new year is set to begin Monday at Nellis Air Force Base.{/p}{p}The base's public affairs office says Red Flag 21-1 will take place from Jan. 15-26.{ }{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1745946403090890844\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Nearly 100 aircraft will take off from Nellis twice a day and could remain in the air for up to five hours during the exercise. author: @Region8News
title: Harp’s to open new store in Brookland
text: Harps to open new store in Brookland BROOKLAND, Ark. (KAIT) - Harps Food Stores, Inc. will be opening a new store in Brookland in January. According to Talk Business and Politics, the store will be located at 8107 U.S. Highway 49 in Brookland, Arkansas. The opening date is set for Wednesday, Jan. 17, with a grand opening at 10 a.m. The 32,000-square-foot store will also feature a Harps Express with gas pumps. “We are thrilled to open our doors in Brookland and become an integral part of this vibrant community,” said Kim Eskew, chairman and CEO of Harps Food Stores. “Our team has been working diligently to bring the best of Harps to this new location, and we can’t wait to share our commitment to quality, value, and service with the wonderful people of Brookland.” Store hours will be from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m., with the store also offering curbside pickup and home delivery. For more information, you can visit [TB&P’s website](https://talkbusiness.net/2023/12/harps-to-open-new-store-in-brookland-in-january/). Copyright 2023 KAIT. All rights reserved.

author: James Powel
title: Wendy's: One-cent Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger offer is limited per customer
text: Bacon bits: Wendy's confirms one cent Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger offer has limit [James Powel](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12244761002/james-powel/) [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) There's only so much bacon that can be brought home. Wendy's is offering a 1-cent Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger in celebration of [National Bacon Day](https://www.nationaldaycalendar.com/national-day/bacon-day-december-30) on December 30. The promotion [launched Wednesday](/story/money/food/2023/12/27/wendys-1-cent-burger-deal/72037785007/) and requires that customers order the penny burger through the company's app or website. A company spokesperson confirmed that the offer is valid for one Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger per customer during the promotion. The deal is an opportunity for customers to relax their wallets after the [holiday spending season](/story/money/2023/11/22/consumer-spending-slows-holidays-inflation/71659583007/). Here's how to claim your 1-cent Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger. When can you get a Wendy's Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger for a penny Wendy's bacon day deal is available between Dec. 27 and Jan. 2 at participating locations. Customers can get one Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger for just 1¢, complete with all the fixings: A beefy patty, applewood smoked bacon, American cheese, lettuce, tomato, and mayo. How to get a Wendy's Jr. Bacon Cheeseburger for one penny Download the Wendy's app or visit the company's [website](https://order.wendys.com/rewards-home?lang=en_US), create a rewards account, and click the "Reward Store." Review the current offers in the reward portal, select the one-cent deal and add it to your order. As long as you have a rewards account, the deal will be added to your cart. Deal hunters don't need to delete the app once they have secured their penny burger: Wendy's often has [other deals](/story/money/food/2023/11/09/free-wendys-chicken-nuggets-wednesdays/71514232007/) throughout the year for reward members, including free fries, chicken nuggets and shakes.

author: Jesús Rubio
title: Así es Inmaculada, la nueva película de terror de Sydney Sweeney
text: Digamos que Inmaculada, la nueva película con Sydney Sweeney, aprueba raspando, quizás porque es el habitual terror religioso con trama trillada, pero relativamente efectiva, que cede cuando recurre a giros de fórmula y a resoluciones perezosas, con diálogos algo tontos y personajes poco atractivos, salvo por dos monjas clave, a las que cometen el error de matar muy rápido. Sweeney, quien también es la productora, hace lo que puede en una película dirigida con cierta solvencia por Michael Mohan, aunque en algunas escenas pareciera que no le queda otra que los gritos sobreactuados y esas miradas de desesperación e inocencia que tan bien le salen, pero que en el contexto de la historia son muy difíciles de sostener. Al contrario de la excelente La primera profecía (estrenada hace un par de meses), con la que comparte terreno, Inmaculada no se arriesga casi nada, como si no se animara a salirse de los estándares de la industria. Es terror en piloto automático, ubicado en la tradición del nunsploitation (películas con monjas) y del eurohorror con curas que quieren engendrar al hijo de Dios y que terminan engendrando al mismísimo Diablo. Y si bien el final es sanguinario y rabioso, lo que lo precede es de una falta de imaginación que aplana la totalidad, aunque tiene un par de sustos aceptables y una fotografía funcional a la atmósfera oscura. Esta vez la víctima es la novicia Cecilia (Sweeney), una joven devota que llega a un convento en la campiña italiana en busca de la consagración espiritual. Apenas llega empieza a ver cosas extrañas y se lleva una mala impresión con el poco amigable recibimiento que le dan, sobre todo el de una monja en particular, la hermana Isabelle (Giulia Heathfield Di Renzi). También aparece otra monja clave, Gwen (Benedetta Porcaroli), quien se hace amiga de Cecilia y le advierte de lo que pasa en el convento. Es Gwen la primera en gritar las verdades del lugar y la que le inspira cierta rebeldía a Cecilia, quien de la noche a la mañana aparece embarazada. ¿La violaron mientras dormía o fue obra del Espíritu Santo? La película se encarga de dar el giro sutilmente sobrenatural, dando a entender que el hijo que espera Cecilia es más del Diablo que de Dios, siempre usando el fuera de campo y sugiriendo con el sonido (uno de los pocos aciertos de puesta en escena). Llama la atención que en las películas de terror con monjas e iglesias aparezca el Mal, justo ahí, en la casa de Dios. Lo bueno es que se puede hacer un paralelismo con la política, ya que la Iglesia y sus representantes exigen a sus devotos pobreza, obediencia y castidad, es decir, lo mismo que exigen la derecha y sus representantes, quienes le piden al pueblo el sacrificio de la obediencia y de la pobreza para que ellos puedan mantener su riqueza y su poder. Si bien el filme es bastante torpe y sus personajes carecen de carisma, el director decide aplicar en el final la furia y el pragmatismo del cine norteamericano, haciendo que la protagonista decida lo que corresponde. Con ese final valiente (aunque obvio), Inmaculada aporta su granito de arena para desenmascarar algunas injusticias. Por esto, y por la esmerada construcción de clima, la película aprueba con lo justo. Para ver “Inmaculada” Immaculate, Estados Unidos/Italia, 2024. Terror. Dirección: Michael Mohan. Guion: Andrew Lobel. Elenco: Sydney Sweeney, Álvaro Morte, Benedetta Porcaroli, Giorgio Colangeli, Dora Romano, Giulia Heathfield Di Renzi, Giampiero Judica, Betty Pedrazzi, Simona Tabasco y Giuseppe Lo Piccolo. Fotografía: Elisha Christian. Música: Will Bates. Duración: 89 minutos. Apta para mayores de 16 años. En cines.

author: ncronline.org
title: Ground News - Cardinal says Vatican is not moving toward accepting gay marriage
text:
Summary by ncronline.org The Vatican 's affirmation that a priest can give an informal blessing to a gay couple that asks for one is not a first step toward the Catholic Church recognizing same-sex marriages, said Cardinal Víctor Manuel Fernández, prefect of the Dicastery for the Doctrine of the Faith. author: Jessica Clark
title: Norway's biggest pension fund boycotts Gulf firms over human rights fears
text: Norway’s biggest pension fund has blacklisted Gulf companies over human rights abuses, including state surveillance and treatment of migrant workers. KLP yesterday said it will boycott firms in the real estate sector in Saudi Arabia, Qatar, the United Arab Emirates and Kuwait, where it said migrant workers have faced human rights violations. The fund manager, which has £55billion of assets under management, also targeted Gulf telecoms companies over concerns they have suppressed freedom of expression. It has separately blacklisted Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, citing a lack of green transition planning and its close ties to the Saudi government. It has withdrawn around £12million from the 12 Gulf companies. Human rights abuses: Riyad in Saudi Arabia. Norway's biggest pension fund said it will boycott firms in the real estate sector in Saudi Arabia, Qatar, the United Arab Emirates and Kuwait The Oslo-based pension scheme said investing in Aramco did not align with its goal to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero by 2050. Aramco is 90 per cent state-owned, which has made it ‘difficult for other shareholders to influence the company through the exercise of active ownership’, KLP said. In a statement yesterday the scheme said: ‘Close links between the state and the company result in a significant overall ability to leverage power and influence in favour of a climate and energy transition policy that runs counter to KLP’s goals.’ Aramco has been contacted for comment. The other firms were excluded due to KLP’s concerns about human rights abuses.

author: Lamantua
title: #11 El sacerdote Antonio Casado: "El obispo de Cádiz me obligó a donar fundaciones de caridad para controlar el dinero"
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
Desde los templarios, los Borgia, el banco Ambrosiano, etc., son tantos los casos que indican que su reino sí es de este mundo, que levanta el ánimo ver que todavía quedan personas dentro de esta institución que creen en algunos pilares éticos. Abogo por más información directa, concreta, constante, para que poco a poco los sinvergüenzas queden cada vez más arrinconados en una sociedad cada vez más autocrítica.
[#2](c2#c-2) Hasta que te informas y resulta que te obligan a hacer chorrocientos trámites y papeleos, además de visitas a parroquias buscando tu registro. Este coñazo echa a mucha gente para atrás.
Ya que en Hacienda se integran tan bien con la iglesia para la X del IRPF, a ver cuándo ponen otra casilla al lado de "QUIERO APOSTATAR".
